TopicTitle: Hey, I'm new around these parts!

Articles.Content:
So I tried the demo and ended up loosing most of my night to it so I decided to buy it. I only got as far as orbiting the earth twice before I bought it and now I\'m confronted with so much more stuff it\'s unreal!

It\'s so confusing and I have no idea how to deal with it all.

Any tips?

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

That\'s what\'s fun about sandbox games, there\'s no limit to what you can do. Build crazy contraptions and see if they fly, head over to the Challenges forum if you want specific goals. You can do anything at zombo.com.

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
Well the problem isn\'t what to do in the game, the problem is that there isn\'t any visible tutorial to help ease me into these new parts I have.

Well yeah, the tutorial hasn\'t been updated in a while and probably won\'t be anytime soon seeing as how much the game can change. They would be spending too much time redoing it after each update.

You can always hop in the IRC channel if you need some people to ask noob questions. Most people in the chat are nice and helpful.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Yes, welcome to the forums TCC, I found trial and error worked best for me (lots of errors), but feel free to ask questions as most people here are happy to help. Don\'t forget the 'how to' thread, there\'s tons of interesting info in there.

I know what you mean, being presented with the massive collection of spaceplane parts is a bit overwhelming at first. The best policy is to stick to parts you recognise until you can get to grips with all the new bits.

-------

Edited August 1, 2018 by flying_chair

hello, and welcome!

you can ask questions!
